Classes

Class EndGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • Classes.EndGame

  • public class EndGame
extends java.lang.Object

    End Game Class

    This class defines what happens when the player loses the game. It contains methods to both read and write the gamescore to a seperate file.
    Since:
    2017-11-30

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      static java.lang.String name 
      static java.io.ObjectOutputStream os

      This method sets up the score for the start of the game.

    • Method Detail

      • youLose

        public void youLose(Classes.Score gameScore,
                    javax.swing.JFrame gameArena)
        This method is called by the MainGame class when the player has lost the game. It closes the main game arena and calls a method to display a seperate JFrame that informs the player the game is over. It also prompts them for their name if they have obtained a new high score.
        Parameters:
        gameScore - contains the current score and the current highscore.
        gameArena - this contains the main game arena so that it may be closed.

      • startScore

        public Classes.Score startScore()
        This method sets up the score for the start of the game. It does this by reading the highScore.data file and returning it. It is called by the mainGame class
        Returns:
        gameScore this returns the score that is saved in the highScore.data file

      • loseFrame

        public static void loseFrame(Classes.Score gameScore)
        This method sets up a JFrame for the end of game and compares the current score to the high score to see if the player got a new high score. It also closes the game.
        Parameters:
        gameScore - This allows the method to display the player's score and tests to see if they obtained a new high score.
